heisig_chinese_memo: A baby is expensive so these two babies walking behind their mother are represented as shellfish. &nbsp

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This woman became too old to have a baby so she adopted a couple of little oyster babies.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscriptions from ◎from " female " to one or two " shells ", which means to wear shell ornaments on women's necks. "Said Wen": "Infants, neck ornaments. From female widows. Widows, their evens." Widows are shells or pearls strung together.

Bronze inscriptions are used as names and surnames. Prince Yingci Zhong: "Prince Yingci is from the first time (made) and the clock, always used for joy." Wang Guowei believed that "Ying Ci" was Chu Ling Yin Zi Chong Ying Qi. "Tong Chi. The Fourth Clan": "Yingshi, Ying surname. "Fun Sutong" says: "After Zhao Yingqi, Doctor Jin.""
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscriptions from ◎ from " female " to one or two " shells ", it means to wear shells on women's neck
humanum_full_description:
金文從◎從「女」從一或二「貝」，會女子頸項佩戴貝飾之意。《說文》：「嬰，頸飾也。从女賏。賏，其連也。」賏是串在一起的貝殼或珍珠。

　　金文用為人名和姓氏。王子嬰次鐘：「王子嬰次自乍(作)龢鐘，永用匽喜」。王國維認為「嬰次」即楚令尹子重嬰齊。《通志．氏族略四》：「嬰氏，嬴姓。《風俗通》云：『晉大夫趙嬰齊之後。』」
humanum_short_description: 金文從◎從「女」從一或二「貝」，會女子頸項佩戴貝飾之意。

Chinese: A baby is expensive so these two babies walking behind their mother are represented as shellfish.  
Meaning: baby
Hanzi: 婴
Story: This woman became too old to have a baby so she adopted a couple of little oyster babies.
Kind: traditional

金文從◎從「 女 」從一或二「 貝 」，會女子頸項佩戴貝飾之意。《說文》：「嬰，頸飾也。从女賏。賏，其連也。」賏是串在一起的貝殼或珍珠。 金文用為人名和姓氏。王子嬰次鐘：「王子嬰次自乍(作)龢鐘，永用匽喜」。王國維認為「嬰次」即楚令尹子重嬰齊。《通志．氏族略四》：「嬰氏，嬴姓。《風俗通》云：『晉大夫趙嬰齊之後。』」
Bronze inscriptions from ◎from " female" to one or two " shells", which means to wear shell ornaments on women's necks. "Said Wen": "Infants, neck ornaments. From female widows. Widows, their evens." Widows are shells or pearls strung together. Bronze inscriptions are used as names and surnames. Prince Yingci Zhong: "Prince Yingci is from the first time (made) and the clock, always used for joy." Wang Guowei believed that "Ying Ci" was Chu Ling Yin Zi Chong Ying Qi. "Tong Chi. The Fourth Clan": "Yingshi, Ying surname. "Fun Sutong" says: "After Zhao Yingqi, Doctor Jin.""

嬰字的基本解释

嬰
yīng
见“婴”。

嬰字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīng］
［《廣韻》於盈切，平清，影。］
亦作“孆1”。亦作“孾1”。“婴1”的繁体字。
(1)颈饰。
(2)系；穿戴。
(3)绕；围绕。
(4)纠缠；羁绊。
(5)遭受；遇。
(6)接触；触犯。
(7)施加。
(8)初生的女孩。
(9)泛指初生儿。
(10)通“纓”。套在马颈上的革带。
(11)通“罌”。
(12)通“鸚”。参见“嬰母”。
(13)姓。

嬰字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【女字部】　嬰； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页273第04
【廣韻】於盈切【集韻】伊盈切【正韻】於京切，?音纓。【釋名】人始生曰嬰兒。胷前曰嬰，抱之嬰前，乳養之，故曰嬰。一曰女曰嬰，男曰孩。　又【六書故】女首飾也。嬰，所以飾也。【荀子·富國篇】處女嬰寶珠。別作瓔。　又加也。【賈誼·治安策】嬰之以芒刃。　又觸也。【韓非子·說難】龍喉下逆鱗，嬰之則殺人。　又繞也。【後漢·卓茂傳】嬰城者相望。　又縈也，絆也。【陸機詩】世網嬰吾身。【張九齡詩】形隨世網嬰。　又山名。【隋圖經】嬰山，幷州之主山。又【山海經】金星之山，多天嬰，其狀如龍骨。　又九嬰，水火之怪。【淮南子·本經訓】堯使誅九嬰于凶水之上。　又盂也。與罌通。【?天子傳】黃金之嬰之屬。　又姓。晉季膺之後。別作賏。　又【集韻】於慶切，音映。關中謂孩子曰嬰。　又於正切，音郢。嬰累，弱也。一曰絆也。

嬰字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

嬰字的起名意思

暂无。

Also known as "孆1". Also known as "孾1". The traditional characters of "宝宝1".

(5) Suffer; encounter.
(6) Contact; offend.
(7) Apply.
(8) Newborn girl.
(9) Generally refers to newborns.
(10) Through "Ying". A leather belt that wraps around a horse's neck.
(11) Link "Poppy".
(12) Through "parrot". See "Infant and Mother".
(13) Last name.
